summary:
iPhone SE 4 might be called iPhone 16E, to launch globally in the first half of 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Apple will be introducing its new iPhone, possibly named the iPhone 16E, in the first half of 2025. The device is rumored to launch by early April 2025, featuring significant upgrades over the previous models.

  • The upcoming iPhone is suggested to be called the iPhone 16E instead of the iPhone SE 4.
  • It will feature a larger 6.06-inch OLED display, a significant upgrade from the SE 3's 4.7-inch LCD.
  • Other upgrades include a Touch ID home button, an A18 chipset with 8GB of RAM, and a 48MP rear camera.
  • Pricing is expected to start around $500 in the US and between Rs 49,000 to Rs 54,000 in India.
“Most the information is based on leaks/rumours, more details will likely be teased soon.”

This anticipated launch is expected to bring notable enhancements to the SE series, making it more comparable to the latest iPhone 16 series.
newTitle: iPhone SE 4 may be renamed iPhone 16E, set for global launch in early 2025

title: GTA 6 set to break all records? Top market analyst firm predicts sales of Rockstar Games to reach $3 billion - Indiatimes.com
summary:
GTA 6 Expected to Set Sales Records with Projections of $3 Billion

Publication Date: 2025 Source: ESPN

GTA 6, one of the most anticipated games, is predicted by market research firm DFC Intelligence to generate over $3 billion in sales within its first year.

  • DFC Intelligence forecasts GTA 6 will achieve milestone sales similar to GTA 5.
  • Initial sales are expected to surpass $1 billion through pre-orders alone.
  • The estimated total sales for the first year, ending in November 2026, is projected to be $2.2 billion.
“GTA 5's success across the last decade will lead to stronger initial sales when Rockstar finally launches GTA 6,” said DFC founder David Cole.

In conclusion, with a robust sales forecast and a strong legacy from its predecessor, GTA 6 is set to break the gaming industry's sales records.
newTitle: GTA 6 Expected to Set Sales Records with Projections of $3 Billion

Samsung and Google take on Dolby Atmos with a new royalty-free audio format - TechSpot
summary:
Samsung and Google take on Dolby Atmos with a new royalty-free audio format

Publication Date: January 4, 2025

Source: TechSpot

Samsung and Google are teaming up to introduce Eclipsa Audio, an open-source spatial audio format aimed at providing advanced 3D sound experiences while competing against Dolby Atmos.

  • Eclipsa Audio is royalty-free, avoiding licensing fees associated with Dolby Atmos.
  • The new format is set to be integrated into YouTube, Samsung TVs, and soundbars in 2025.
  • A certification program will ensure quality across devices.
  • Samsung's push reflects a need to cut costs in a competitive market.
  • Jim Bankoski from Google highlights the transformative potential of Eclipsa Audio for sound experiences.
“We believe that Eclipsa Audio has the potential to change the way we experience sound.” - Jim Bankoski, VP of Engineering at Google Chrome

As CES 2025 approaches, the tech world waits to see if Eclipsa can truly compete with Dolby Atmos.
newTitle: Samsung and Google introduce Eclipsa Audio to challenge Dolby Atmos

title: Apple Intelligence now takes up almost twice as much room on your iPhone as it used to - TechRadar
summary:
Apple Intelligence now takes up almost twice as much room on your iPhone as it used to

Date: January 3, 2025
Source: TechRadar

Apple Intelligence now requires 7GB of storage with the new iOS 18.2 update, up from 4GB in the previous version, due to added features and expected further increases in the future.

  • Apple Intelligence now needs 7GB, an increase from 4GB.
  • This increase is attributed to new features in iOS 18.2.
  • Future requirements are projected to grow further.
"If you're running low on storage space on your device, then you may have to think twice about having Apple Intelligence enabled."

Apple's focus on local AI processing enhances privacy but poses storage challenges for users. Those needing to manage their device's space may need to reconsider their use of Apple Intelligence.
newTitle: Apple Intelligence Storage Requirement Doubles with iOS 18.2 Update
